io.github.thunderbots.lightning.opmode

Class TeleOp

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.OpMode
      • com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode
        • io.github.thunderbots.lightning.opmode.LightningOpMode
          • io.github.thunderbots.lightning.opmode.SimpleOpMode
            • io.github.thunderbots.lightning.opmode.TeleOp
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TeleOpTest

    public abstract class TeleOp
extends SimpleOpMode
    The TeleOp class is a base class that all tele-op programs should extend. It will handle everything directly related to driving and moving the robot, but nothing substantial beyond that.
    Author:
    Zach Ohara

    • Method Detail

      • main

        protected void main()
        Description copied from class: LightningOpMode
        Executes the 'main procedure' of the op mode. This method will run either until interrupted by the system, or until the method returns.
        Specified by:
        main in class LightningOpMode

      • initializeOpMode

        protected void initializeOpMode()
        Description copied from class: LightningOpMode
        Initializes the robot. This can be defined however it is seen fit by the specific overriding op mode. Any op mode that overrides this method should also call super.initializeOpMode() on the first line.
        Overrides:
        initializeOpMode in class LightningOpMode
        See Also:
        LightningOpMode.isInitialized

      • setMovement

        protected void setMovement()
        Sets the instantaneous movement of the robot based on readings from the joysticks.

      • mainLoop

        protected void mainLoop()
        Executes the 'body' of any tele op. Everything controlled by a teleop that would normally be done inside a while loop should be placed in this method. Movement is excluded from this, and should instead be defined in setMovement().

      • createControlLayout

        public ControlLayout createControlLayout()
        Constructs the joystick control layout that the op mode should use. A drive-turn layout is provided as the default, but that can be replaced by overriding this method.
        Returns:
        a constructed ControlLayout that should be used for this op mode.

      • getControlLayout

        protected ControlLayout getControlLayout()
        Gets a reference to the ControlLayout that this op mode is using.
        Returns:
        the control layout of this op mode.
